wikipedia_page.main: Robert Macfarlan (also Macfarlane) (1734–1804) was a Scottish schoolmaster, notable as a writer, journalist and translator.

response: * Robert Macfarlan (schoolmaster) (1734–1804), Scottish writer, journalist and translator
* Robert Macfarlane (New Zealand politician) (1900–1982), New Zealand politician
* George Buchanan's De Jure Regni apud Scotos (1579) is translated by Robert Macfarlan as A Dialogue Concerning The Rights of the Crown in Scotland.
